content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Line (x=1-5, y=1-3.5)
Consists of three parallel smelting setups:
- Furnace (1,1) with burner inserter (1.5,2.5) outputting to chest (1.5,3.5)
- Furnace (3,1) with burner inserter (3.5,2.5) outputting to chest (3.5,3.5)
- Furnace (5,1) with burner inserter (5.5,2.5) outputting to chest (5.5,3.5)

### Copper Plate Production Line (x=2-4.5, y=7-9.5)
Consists of two parallel smelting setups:
- Furnace (2,7) with burner inserter (2.5,8.5) outputting to chest (2.5,9.5)
- Furnace (4,7) with burner inserter (4.5,8.5) outputting to chest (4.5,9.5)

### Copper Cable Production Setup (x=11.5-14.5, y=11.5-14.5)
- Assembling machine (14.5,14.5) producing copper cable
- Input chest (14.5,11.5) with burner inserter (14.5,12.5) feeding copper plates
- Output burner inserter (12.5,14.5) moving cables to storage chest (11.5,14.5)

### Power Generation System (x=2.5-13.5, y=33.5-37.5)
- Offshore pump (2.5,35.5) extracting water
- Pipe network connecting pump to boiler
- Boiler (7,35.5) converting water to steam
- Steam engine (13.5,35.5) generating electricity
- Connected to electrical network via power poles

### Electrical Distribution Network
Network of small electric poles connecting power generation to various machines and covering the production area.

ERROR TIPS

### Entity Placement and Configuration Issues
- When reconfiguring assembly machine setups, remove existing inserters and chests before placing new ones to avoid conflicts
- Ensure proper alignment between inserters, chests and assembly machines for efficient item transfer

### Resource Management
- Monitor fuel levels in burner inserters and boilers to maintain continuous operation
- Keep input chests stocked with sufficient materials to prevent production interruptions

### Production Flow Issues
- Ensure proper positioning of inserters relative to assembly machines for optimal input/output flow
- Configure inserter pickup and drop positions correctly to maintain production efficiency
